citations.narrative:
There are incomplete or missing acquisition and disposition records for multiple animals. For acquisition records of the
following animals, there is information missing from whom animals were acquired, such as state driver's license and
vehicle plate number of non-USDA licensed persons: an alpaca "Sun King", African grey parrots "Dharbi" & "Nouveau",
and a common raven "Bruce". There is no disposition record for a deceased and unidentified red fox. The records of
acquisition, disposition, and animals on hand are necessary to track the movement of animals. Every dealer other than
operators of auction sales and brokers to whom animals are consigned, and exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain
records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information in this subpart CFR 2.75(b)(1)(i-vii) concerning animals
other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or
under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor.
Correct by 27 March 2025.

The facility is not following the Program of Vet Care (PVC) for parasite prevention. The 10 adult wolf-dog hybrids have not
been administered any parasite prevention according to the facility representative. The current PVC prescribes for
parasite prevention as "credelio p.o. monthly spring through fall, ivermectin monthly, fenbendazole monthly". Failure to
follow the PVC for preventative care and screening can leave the dogs susceptible to diseases or parasites, which, if
contracted, would cause pain, distress, and suffering.
Correct by administering all of the preventative care for parasite control, in accordance with a schedule approved by the
Attending Veterinarian.
Correct by 27 March 2025.

A male red fox "Tommy" had injuries that required veterinary care sustained from presumptive fighting with other foxes he
was housed with, as stated by facility records. On 03 February 2025, Tommy was found to have an approximately 4-inch
laceration on the dorsal neck that required sutures. The facility had prior incidents between animals in the outdoor
enclosure housing Tommy and 5 other red foxes and had initiated separation of some of the male animals. A facility
representative stated that Tommy does not play well with others and indicated that there are further plans for separation
of animals while Tommy heals in isolation. Failure to house compatible animals in the same primary enclosure can lead to
severe injuries or even death of animals. Animals shall not be housed near animals that interfere with their health or
cause them discomfort.
Correct from this date forward of 17 March 2025.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The current avian environment enhancement plan does not have a written provision for individually housed social species
of birds that are unable to see and hear birds of their own or compatible species. An African grey parrot "Dharbi" that is
housed in the office, became singly housed when an adjacently housed parrot of the same species "Nouveau" passed
away on 16 January 2025. Without a written plan for special attention, this social bird may develop abnormal behaviors
and could experience psychological distress. The facility must develop, document, and implement an adequate
enrichment plan with the attending veterinarian's approval for all their birds, including special attention regarding
enhancement of the environment of those individually housed social species of birds that are unable to see and hear birds
of their own or compatible species.
Correct by 14 April 2025.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
There are incomplete or missing acquisition and disposition records for multiple animals. For acquisition records of the 
following animals, there is information missing from whom animals were acquired, such as state driver's license and 
vehicle plate number of non-USDA licensed persons: an alpaca "Sun King", African grey parrots "Dharbi" & "Nouveau", 
and a common raven "Bruce". There is no disposition record for a deceased and unidentified red fox. The records of 
acquisition, disposition, and animals on hand are necessary to track the movement of animals. Every dealer other than 
operators of auction sales and brokers to whom animals are consigned, and exhibitor shall make, keep, and maintain 
records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information in this subpart CFR 2.75(b)(1)(i-vii) concerning animals 
other than dogs and cats, purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, leased, or otherwise in his or her possession or 
under his or her control, or which is transported, sold, euthanized, or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. 
 
Correct by 27 March 2025. 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility is not following the Program of Vet Care (PVC) for parasite prevention. The 10 adult wolf-dog hybrids have not 
been administered any parasite prevention according to the facility representative. The current PVC prescribes for 
parasite prevention as "credelio p.o. monthly spring through fall, ivermectin monthly, fenbendazole monthly". Failure to 
follow the PVC for preventative care and screening can leave the dogs susceptible to diseases or parasites, which, if 
contracted, would cause pain, distress, and suffering. 
Correct by administering all of the preventative care for parasite control, in accordance with a schedule approved by the 
Attending Veterinarian. 
 
Correct by 27 March 2025. 
3.133  Critical
   
Separation.

A male red fox "Tommy" had injuries that required veterinary care sustained from presumptive fighting with other foxes he 
was housed with, as stated by facility records. On 03 February 2025, Tommy was found to have an approximately 4-inch 
laceration on the dorsal neck that required sutures. The facility had prior incidents between animals in the outdoor 
enclosure housing Tommy and 5 other red foxes and had initiated separation of some of the male animals. A facility 
representative stated that Tommy does not play well with others and indicated that there are further plans for separation 
of animals while Tommy heals in isolation. Failure to house compatible animals in the same primary enclosure can lead to 
severe injuries or even death of animals. Animals shall not be housed near animals that interfere with their health or 
cause them discomfort. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 17 March 2025. 
3.154(c)(4) 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The current avian environment enhancement plan does not have a written provision for individually housed social species 
of birds that are unable to see and hear birds of their own or compatible species. An African grey parrot "Dharbi" that is 
housed in the office, became singly housed when an adjacently housed parrot of the same species "Nouveau" passed 
away on 16 January 2025. Without a written plan for special attention, this social bird may develop abnormal behaviors 
and could experience psychological distress. The facility must develop, document, and implement an adequate 
enrichment plan with the attending veterinarian's approval for all their birds, including special attention regarding 
enhancement of the environment of those individually housed social species of birds that are unable to see and hear birds 
of their own or compatible species. 
 
Correct by 14 April 2025. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
